summary: A video by Nasser sharing his note-taking methods using an iPad, including a detailed color-coding strategy for efficient study.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing a black hoodie with the text "TORONTO VS EVERYBODY" sitting at a desk, engaging in a discussion or presentation. The desk is adorned with an orange water bottle, a jar of candies, a potted plant, and a laptop covered in colorful stickers. Behind him, a neon sign reads "Kharma Media," and a large anatomical drawing of a human skeleton is visible on the wall. The man gestures with his hands as he speaks, emphasizing his points. The scene transitions to a close-up of a tablet on a wooden table, where a hand is seen using a stylus to write on the screen, indicating a focus on digital note-taking or drawing. The video then returns to the man at the desk, who continues to speak and gesture, with the text "Links in the description down below" appearing at the bottom of the screen, suggesting additional resources or information are available. The overall setting is a casual, creative workspace, with the man appearing engaged and enthusiastic about the topic he is discussing.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker announcing that the video is sponsored by a product called "Paperlike." He describes Paperlike as a screen protector that makes writing or drawing on an iPad feel like paper, encouraging the audience to click the links in the description for more information. The speaker uses a professional and clear tone. There are no detectable ambient sounds or music throughout the clip.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a black hoodie with the text "TORONTO VS EVERYBODY" is seated at a desk, engaging in a discussion or presentation. The desk is adorned with various items, including an orange water bottle, a jar filled with colorful objects, a potted plant, and a laptop covered in stickers. Behind him, a neon sign reads "Kharma Media," and a large anatomical drawing of a human skeleton is visible on the wall. The man uses hand gestures to emphasize his points, occasionally pointing to a tablet in front of him. The tablet screen displays a document with handwritten notes and annotations, suggesting a focus on educational or technical content. The atmosphere is casual and creative, with the man appearing enthusiastic and engaged in his topic. The video transitions to a close-up of the tablet, highlighting the detailed notes and annotations, before returning to the man at the desk, continuing his discussion.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a friendly, upbeat male voice introducing himself as "Karma Medic" and welcoming listeners to another "dose." He mentions being a third-year medical student and having gone paperless with his iPad Pro, noting its use for note-taking. The speaker describes receiving comments about his color-coding strategy when using the app Notability. He explains how the audience can use or build on his strategy based on his explanation. As the speaker concludes this segment, background music of an electronic style, having a mellow and optimistic mood, fades in.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a person wearing a black hoodie with the text "TORONTO VS EVERYBODY" sitting at a desk in a well-lit room. The desk is adorned with an orange water bottle, a jar of candy, a potted plant, and a laptop covered in colorful stickers. Behind the person, a neon sign reads "Kharma Media," and a large anatomical drawing of a human skeleton is visible on the wall. The person is seen interacting with a tablet, using a stylus to navigate through various applications and content. The video includes a series of transitions showing different screens, such as a YouTube channel page, a social media profile, and a detailed handwritten note titled "Important Stuff: The Immune System and Disease." The person gestures with their hands while speaking, indicating an engaging presentation or discussion. The atmosphere is casual and educational, with the person appearing focused and enthusiastic about the topic at hand.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker discussing his preferred note-taking app on his iPad Pro, stating, "I use an app called Notability." He shares that he finds it the best note-taking app. He makes a remark about how his notes "look really messy," but can still read them. To prove his point, he rapidly reads a series of notes aloud. He then moves onto the topic of how he color-codes his notes.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a person wearing a black hoodie with the text "TORONTO VS EVERYBODY" is seated at a desk, engaging in a discussion or presentation. The individual is holding a stylus and interacting with a tablet, which displays a colorful and detailed handwritten note. The background features a whiteboard filled with handwritten notes and diagrams, alongside a large anatomical drawing of a human skeleton. The desk is adorned with various items, including an orange water bottle, a jar of candies, a potted plant, and a laptop covered in stickers. The person gestures with their hands while speaking, emphasizing points and occasionally pointing to the tablet screen. The atmosphere is educational and focused, with the person appearing to explain or teach about the content displayed on the tablet and whiteboard. The video captures the person's dynamic interaction with the materials, highlighting their engagement in the subject matter.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with one male speaker describing his note-taking system, including the structure of the page with title and three columns. The speaker states the system increases hierarchy and organization of the page and also helps with memorization based on the information's physical location. The speaker then describes how the pages are read, the first one having very solid colors. He explains he uses the second page that has more neutral colors, and custom pale colors as they are easier on the eyes during long studying sessions. The speaker then expresses interest in discussing specific colors and their meanings.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a person wearing a black hoodie with the text "TORONTO VS EVERYBODY" is seated at a desk, engaging in a discussion or presentation. The individual is surrounded by various objects, including an orange water bottle, a jar filled with colorful candies, a potted plant, and a laptop adorned with colorful stickers. Behind them, a whiteboard filled with handwritten notes and diagrams is visible, along with a large anatomical drawing of the human body. The person uses hand gestures and a stylus to interact with a tablet placed on the desk, pointing to different sections of the screen. The tablet displays a list of topics related to pharmacological mechanisms, such as "Pharmacological Mechanisms," "Pharmacokinetics," and "Pharmacodynamics." The person appears to be explaining or teaching these concepts, as indicated by their gestures and the use of the stylus to highlight specific items on the tablet. The environment is well-lit, and the atmosphere suggests an educational or instructional setting. The video transitions between close-up shots of the tablet screen and wider shots of the person at the desk, emphasizing the interaction with the tablet and the educational content being presented.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker describing his method of using a bright pink color to write the title of his lectures. He explains his organization system where lectures are numbered and correspond to specific topics within the same subject of his notes. He references a lecture titled "Lecture 03" which is on the subject of "HIV pathogenesis."

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a person wearing a black hoodie with the text "TORONTO VS EVERYBODY" is seated at a desk, engaging in a presentation or discussion. The individual is using a stylus to interact with a tablet, which displays a colorful and detailed handwritten document with various annotations and highlights. The background features a whiteboard with additional notes and a large anatomical drawing of a human skeleton, suggesting an educational or informative setting. On the desk, there is an orange water bottle, a small potted plant, and a laptop adorned with colorful stickers. The person gestures with their hands while speaking, indicating an explanation or elaboration on the content displayed on the tablet. The video includes close-up shots of the tablet screen, showcasing the handwritten notes and annotations in detail. The atmosphere is focused and academic, with the person actively engaging with the material and the audience.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker detailing a note-taking method, describing how he writes "lecture headings or the subtitles" in a light blue color. He further elaborates on writing general information in light gray, clarifying its purpose as not being a title or something important. He mentions this would be the main pen he uses for most of his writing.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a person wearing a black hoodie with the text "TORONTO VS EVERYBODY" is seated at a desk, engaging in a detailed explanation or discussion. The individual uses a stylus to interact with a tablet, which displays a colorful, handwritten document with various annotations and highlights. The background features a whiteboard with a detailed anatomical drawing and a neon sign that reads "Karma Media." On the desk, there is an orange water bottle, a jar filled with colorful candies, and a laptop adorned with various stickers. The person gestures with their hands, emphasizing points while occasionally pointing to the tablet screen. The video includes close-up shots of the tablet, showing the person's hand interacting with the stylus and highlighting specific sections of the document. The person appears focused and engaged, using the tablet as a visual aid to support their explanation. The overall setting is a well-organized workspace with a creative and educational atmosphere.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker describing the colors he uses in his lecture notes, mentioning a dark yellow-orangey color for subheadings and lists, and red for highlighting important information. The speaker's tone is informative and instructive. He mentions the ability to import and paste pictures, such as lecture slides, onto an iPad, which he then uses for further annotation. The speaker is then interrupted by a young girl, presumably his daughter, who enters the room. The male speaker greets her with a warm tone as she brings him some food. The clip ends with the male speaker ready to continue the video.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a person wearing a black hoodie with the text "Toronto vs Everybody" is seated at a desk, holding a stylus and gesturing while speaking. The desk is adorned with an orange water bottle, a potted plant, and a jar filled with colorful candies. To the right, a laptop covered in various stickers is visible, and a tablet lies in front of the person. The background features a whiteboard with handwritten notes in multiple colors, including pink, blue, yellow, and red, and a large anatomical drawing of a human skeleton. The person appears to be explaining or discussing the content on the whiteboard, using hand gestures to emphasize points. The video transitions to a close-up of the tablet screen, displaying handwritten notes in different colors, with the person using the stylus to point at specific sections. The notes include headings and subheadings, with some text highlighted in blue and purple. The person continues to explain the content, occasionally looking at the tablet and the whiteboard. The video concludes with the person still seated at the desk, holding the stylus and gesturing, with the whiteboard and anatomical drawing in the background. The overall setting suggests an educational or instructional environment, with the person likely providing a detailed explanation or tutorial on the subject matter displayed on the whiteboard and tablet.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip features a single male speaker with a calm, informative tone, explaining the color-coding system used in his notes. "Dark purple" is used for information considered "high yield", likely to appear on tests, while "light purple" indicates information from past tests that must be memorized. He emphasizes the importance of light purple, stating "know this, know this, know this" before introducing the sponsor of the video, Paperlike.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a person wearing a black hoodie with the text "Toronto vs. Everybody" and "Champions" on it, sitting at a desk with a tablet and a stylus. The individual is engaged in a discussion or presentation, gesturing with the stylus and occasionally pointing to the tablet. The desk is adorned with an orange water bottle, a jar of candy, and a laptop covered in colorful stickers. In the background, a whiteboard displays a drawing of a human skeleton, and a neon sign reads "Forma Media." The scene transitions to a close-up of a hand flipping through a notebook filled with handwritten notes and highlighted text, indicating a focus on study or research. The video then returns to the person at the desk, continuing their discussion with the stylus, emphasizing points with hand gestures. The setting remains consistent throughout, with the same objects and background elements, creating a cohesive and focused atmosphere centered around the individual's presentation or explanation.
events_list.audio_caption: A male speaker describes the Paperlike product, emphasizing that it makes writing on the iPad feel like paper, providing extra grip and protection. He says that using it has been a "natural transition from writing on paper to writing on an electronic device" and highlights how it helps protect the screen, even mentioning that it has "already saved me on more than one occasion." He talks excitedly about the product and its benefits. He concludes by saying that he will leave links to the product in the description. Finally, he transitions back to the video.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a person wearing a black hoodie with the text "TORONTO VS EVERYBODY" is seated at a desk, engaging in a discussion or presentation. The individual is holding a stylus and appears to be explaining or elaborating on the content displayed on a tablet in front of them. The tablet screen shows handwritten notes and diagrams, with various colors used to highlight different sections, including green, red, and blue. The background features a whiteboard with additional notes and a large anatomical drawing of a human skeleton. On the desk, there is an orange water bottle, a small potted plant, and a laptop covered in colorful stickers. The person uses hand gestures to emphasize points, occasionally pointing to the tablet screen or the whiteboard. The atmosphere suggests an educational or instructional setting, possibly related to medical or anatomical studies, as indicated by the content on the whiteboard and the anatomical drawing. The video captures the person's active engagement with the material, using both the tablet and the whiteboard as visual aids to convey information.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a single, presumably male speaker who highlights that the next color of importance to him is light green. He continues, speaking about how light green is only reserved for information related to drugs, treatment, or drug management, and how he can easily identify drug-related information when scrolling. He uses an example in a matter-of-fact tone: "first-line treatment is methotrexate," and then gives another example of the anti-TNF alpha therapy which are often prescribed. He notes that some may not be able to read what he wrote, but as long as he can, that is what is important. He finds this helpful, especially in exams when dealing with different names of drugs, noting how it can help him remember lecture notes. He summarizes that it is a helpful way for him to further categorize information, and that it works very well.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a person wearing a black hoodie with the text "TORONTO VS EVERYBODY" is seated at a desk, engaging with a tablet. The individual is using a stylus to interact with the tablet, which displays a digital drawing or note-taking application. The background features a whiteboard with handwritten notes and a list of colors, including Pink, Blue, Grey, Red, Dark Purple, Light Purple, Light Green, and Light Brown. A large anatomical drawing of a human skeleton is also visible on the wall behind the person. The desk is adorned with various items, including an orange water bottle, a small potted plant, a jar filled with colorful objects, and a laptop covered in stickers. The person appears to be explaining or discussing the content on the tablet, using hand gestures to emphasize points. The setting suggests an educational or creative workspace, with a focus on visual aids and digital tools.
events_list.audio_caption: A single speaker, presumably male, discusses the color brown in note-taking, describing it as a marker for information deemed important enough to write down on a second review. The speaker's tone is informative and slightly analytical, emphasizing the color's significance in standing out among other colors.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a person wearing a black hoodie with the text "TORONTO VS EVERYBODY" is seated at a desk, engaging in a discussion or presentation. The individual is using hand gestures to emphasize points while speaking. The desk is adorned with various items, including an orange water bottle, a potted plant, a jar filled with colorful objects, and a laptop covered in stickers. Behind the person, a whiteboard displays handwritten notes and diagrams, with a list of colors on the right side, including Pink, Blue, Grey, Dark Grey, Red, Dark Purple, Light Purple, Light Green, Brown, and Highlighting. The background features a large anatomical drawing of a human skeleton, and the word "Media" is visible on the wall. The person interacts with a tablet, using a stylus to point at and highlight specific sections of the notes on the whiteboard, which include topics such as "Medicine" and "Medicine System." The video captures the individual's focused and animated presentation style, with the consistent setting and background elements providing a cohesive and informative atmosphere.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip features a male speaker discussing highlighting techniques for note-taking using various colored highlighters. He mentions the aesthetic of color combinations and recommends using darker colors when necessary. He acknowledges a beeping sound, dismissing it, and asserts that highlighting is about personal preference and emphasizing important information. He concludes by stating that he has covered all colors he uses in his color-coding system in Notability while taking lecture notes at medical school.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a person wearing a black hoodie with the text "TORONTO VS EVERYBODY" sitting at a desk, engaging in a conversation or presentation. The desk is adorned with various items, including an orange water bottle, a tablet with a stylus, and a laptop covered in colorful stickers. Behind the person, a whiteboard displays a drawing of a human skeleton, and a neon sign reads "KharmaMedic." The individual uses hand gestures to emphasize points during the discussion. The video includes a call to action with a "SUBSCRIBE" button and a thumbs-up icon, encouraging viewers to subscribe to the channel. The video concludes with a screen displaying two empty rectangles labeled "PREVIOUS VIDEO" and "WATCH NOW!" along with social media icons for Instagram, Twitter, and Facebook, all associated with the handle "@KharmaMedic."
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a male speaker expressing hope that listeners enjoyed the video and learned something new. He encourages viewers to like the video and subscribe for more content, concluding with a sign-off and a promise to see them again at the same time and place, followed by a farewell. The audio clip ends abruptly.
